message_1: What is the efficiency of a gamma-ray detector if it detects 100 gamma-ray interactions for every 500 gamma-rays that hit the detector?
message_2:
The efficiency of a gamma-ray detector can be calculated using the following formula:

Efficiency = (Number of detected gamma-ray interactions / Total number of gamma-rays that hit the detector) * 100

In this case, the detector detects 100 gamma-ray interactions out of 500 gamma-rays that hit the detector. So, the efficiency would be:

Efficiency = (100 / 500) * 100 = 0.2 * 100 = 20%

The efficiency of the gamma-ray detector is 20%.
